description.summary: Let emacs manage wayland windows and input.

protocol.description:
One ewp_layout client decides the layout for new surfaces (= windows).
The wayland server sends the new_surface event on xdg_shell toplevel creation and creates a ewp_surface object.
The layout client can then layout this ewp_surface object.
in ewp: ewp_layout -> ewp_surface in emacs: client=events,requests -> wayland buffer
ewp_layout object gets notified about new toplevel surfaces -> ewp_surface

interface.name: ewp_layout
interface.description: An interface for a window manager client

event.name: new_surface
event.description: Inform the client after a new surface was added. The client uses the new ewp_surface object to manage this surface.

interface.name: ewp_surface
interface.description: An interface to manage a single toplevel surface.

request.name: layout
request.description: Layout surface by setting its x and y position and its width and height size. Shows the surface at x and y of its parent with width and height.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Request the destruction of this surface. This request is acknowledged by the destroy event.

event.name: destroy
event.description: Inform the client of the destruction of this surface.

event.name: update_title
event.description: Inform the client about a new title for this surface.

event.name: focus
event.description: Inform the client about focus entering this surface.
